natural solution: We can write \begin{align} \frac{\tan x}{\sec x + 1} - \frac{\sec x - 1}{\tan x} &= \frac{\frac{\sin x}{\cos x}}{\frac{1}{\cos x} + 1} - \frac{\frac{1}{\cos x} - 1}{\frac{\sin x}{\cos x}} \\ &= \frac{\sin x}{1 + \cos x} - \frac{1 - \cos x}{\sin x} \\

&= \frac{\sin^2 x - (1 - \cos x)(1 + \cos x)}{(1 + \cos x) \sin x} \\ &= \frac{\sin^2 x - (1 - \cos^2 x)}{(1 + \cos x) \sin x} \\ &= \frac{\sin^2 x + \cos^2 x - 1}{(1 + \cos x) \sin x} \\ &= \boxed{0}.
